name: Mini Exhibitions
headline: Virtual events for remote teams
tags: industry:marketplace; industry:human-resources; industry:b2b; industry:entertainment; industry:creator-economy; location:new-york
generated_description:
Mini Exhibitions is redefining how remote teams come together through engaging virtual events. Founded in New York and proudly part of Y Combinator's Batch W20, this startup is a small but capable team of two, offering a unique membership program that takes the hassle out of organizing remote activities. 

The mission is clear: to create memorable experiences for teams scattered across the globe. Whether it's a mixology class or a live spelling bee, Mini Exhibitions boasts a diverse catalog of over 100 quirky events that you'll love but might not have considered. They handle all the details—sending emails, managing RSVPs, and even shipping goodies to participants—allowing you to kick back and enjoy the fun without the administrative headache.

With flat pricing regardless of attendance, businesses won’t have to fret over budgeting for the number of participants. Plus, they cater to different cultural celebrations and can customize events as needed, reflecting a commitment to inclusivity within the workplace. 

They're not just about events either; Mini Exhibitions embraces technology to facilitate communication through shared Slack channels, making it easy to gauge interest and build excitement within your team.

Trusted by notable companies like Amazon, Spotify, and Stripe, Mini Exhibitions is rapidly establishing itself in the marketplace of remote team engagement. So, if you’re looking to enliven your team's virtual experience without lifting a finger, head on over to [Mini Exhibitions](https://miniexhibitions.com/) and let them do the heavy lifting for you.
